Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Roseocin (Thr-rich; natural AMPs; two-chain lantibiotic, type 2, class 1 bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS2b)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence of chain A (RosA1) is most similar (42.1%) tolantibiotic Subtilomycin. It contains 4 thioether rings and one S-S bond. The sequence of Chain RosA2  is GSGVLGTLGCCSCLPWYSGWTVCGLACNPGKPCKN containing 6 thioether rings, more than other beta chain. This is the first two-chain lantibiotic from a non-Firmicute.Toxicity:  Inhibition zone: A single chain is inactive but becomes active when combined against Gram+ bacteria. L. monocytogenes  MTCC 839 (+++), B. subtilis MTCC 121 (+++) but weakly against E. coli MTCC 1610. Edited 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Singh M, Chaudhary S, Sareen D.2019
Literature Information.Title: Roseocin, a Novel Two-Component Lantibiotic from an Actinomycete
